title: RWBY: Grimm Eclipse
notes: Mobs (Player and enemy) are invisible. [Tested single player only]

title: RWBY: Grimm Eclipse
notes: The game does not works properly with DirectX 11. You can set the following launch option to use DirectX 9: PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 %command%
os: Arch Linux (Linux leeo-arch-msi 4.18.4-zen1-1-zen #1 ZEN SMP PREEMPT Wed Aug 22 07:33:52 UTC 2018 x86_64 GNU/Linux)
specs: Intel® Core™ i5-7300HQ / NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 (2GB)

title: RWBY: Grimm Eclipse
notes: Player and enemy models don't load. Slight audio crackling. Excessive startup time.

title: RWBY: Grimm Eclipse
notes: The game is in fact playable at 60FPS, but DirectX 9 MUST be used. Add this to your launch options; PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 %command%

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon R9 200 Series (HAWAII, DRM 3.27.0, 4.19.0-1-MANJARO, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: runs perfectly after setting the launch options as noted by others: PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 %command%
title: RWBY: Grimm Eclipse

notes: As noted, D3d11 must be disabled with [PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 %command%] for character and enemy models to appear. Game runs flawlessly after this with keyboard and mouse, but disabling D3d11 also disables the controller for some reason. Removing the option re-enables the controller, but obviously renders the game unplayable due to invisible models.
title: RWBY: Grimm Eclipse

notes: Runs well, but characters and NPCs are invisible without "PROTON_NO_D3D11=1 %command%" launch command.
title: RWBY: Grimm Eclipse
